Reason: The 'disk_failure_policy' configuration does not directly involve any performance-related operations that are time-extensive or memory-extensive within its related code. The configuration mainly determines the behavior of the system in response to disk failures or errors, such as stopping transports, marking disks as unwritable, or ignoring errors. While these actions may have system-level impacts, they are not performance-sensitive in terms of causing notable performance variations due to time-expensive or memory-expensive operations.
